description: a(1) = a(2) = 1, a(n) is largest prime factor of concatenation of a(n - 2) and a(n - 1).
example: a(6) = 37379 because the concatenation of a(4) and a(5) is 37379, a prime number.a(7) = 130369 because the concatenation of a(5) and a(6) is 37937379 = 3 * 97 * 130369.
author: _Erich Friedman_
extensions: Corrected and extended by _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 24 2012
